channel.title: I Want to Uninstall, But There's No Uninstaller!
channel.description: Why isn't there an uninstall function in Black Mesa's files? I've tried uninstalling on Steam, but it wouldn't let me. I tried to seek an uninstall icon in the folder, but zilch. How do you uninstall Black Mesa?

item.title: I Want to Uninstall, But There's No Uninstaller!
item.dc:creator: Flatline
item.description:
Question answered, snark delivered. Closing.

Read full topic
item.source: I Want to Uninstall, But There's No Uninstaller!

item.title: I Want to Uninstall, But There's No Uninstaller!
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
They could save up. I’ve had the money to upgrade maybe 3 times in the past 2 years. One of which being the 1TB external for under 100 USD that holds my Steam games/mods.

Read full topic

item.title: I Want to Uninstall, But There's No Uninstaller!
item.dc:creator: D3lta
item.description:
ivoriesablaze:

When you don’t have money, what are you supposed to do? Rob a bank?

They are not even that expensive.You can get a 500 gb HDD for 30 - 50 euros, and a 1TB HDD for 60 - 80 euros.

item.title: I Want to Uninstall, But There's No Uninstaller!
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Just delete the BMS folder in the Sourcemods directory.

It’s located Program Files(x86)/Steam/steamapps/

Read full topic

item.title: I Want to Uninstall, But There's No Uninstaller!
item.dc:creator: Boundaryman
item.description:
Why isn’t there an uninstall function in Black Mesa’s files? I’ve tried uninstalling on Steam, but it wouldn’t let me. I tried to seek an uninstall icon in the folder, but zilch. How do you uninstall Black Mesa?
